info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:44PM CDT until June 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following counties, Merrick and Nance.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly small creeks and rural roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated pockets of moderate to heavy rain still passing through parts of the Advisory area. While the more concentrated heavy rain from a few hours ago has ended, much of the Advisory area has received 1 to 3 inches of rain this afternoon and early evening, with a few more inches of rain possible through the overnight hours. Minor flooding is likely ongoing or could still begin shortly in parts of the area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Warm Slough, Moores Creek, Silver Creek, Prairie Slough and Prairie Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Central City, Clarks, Silver Creek, Chapman and Archer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING
